paragraphs.body: Kori Morishita was the daughter of Mayor ${link_0}, a ${link_1} citizen, and ${link_2}, an ${link_3}. Kori was extremely protective of her home town and its multicultural residents to the point where she would attempt an assassination of ${link_4} ${link_5} in order to preserve her home. It was her determination which eventually inspired Zuko to halt the ${link_6}. Following the conclusion of the ${link_7}, Kori took part in the talks on the future of Yu Dao, and with her support, a new coalition government was elected, representing both Fire Nation and Earth Kingdom residents.
paragraphs.text: Kori Morishita was the daughter of Mayor Morishita, a Fire Nation citizen, and his wife, an earthbender. Kori was extremely protective of her home town and its multicultural residents to the point where she would attempt an assassination of Fire Lord Zuko in order to preserve her home. It was her determination which eventually inspired Zuko to halt the Harmony Restoration Movement. Following the conclusion of the battle for Yu Dao, Kori took part in the talks on the future of Yu Dao, and with her support, a new coalition government was elected, representing both Fire Nation and Earth Kingdom residents.

paragraphs.body: Kori was born to Mayor Morishita and his wife in the ${link_0} ${link_1} of Yu Dao, and was raised to honor both the ${link_2} and her hometown. During her youth, she was given some form of earthbending training as well as additional weapons training, where she learned to use a ${link_3} hammer. In early 100 ${link_4}, she met ${link_5}, a former ${link_6} rebel who had traveled to Yu Dao after the dissolution of his ${link_7}, and the two of them fell in love and began a romantic relationship.
paragraphs.text: Kori was born to Mayor Morishita and his wife in the Fire Nation colony of Yu Dao, and was raised to honor both the Fire Nation Royal Family and her hometown. During her youth, she was given some form of earthbending training as well as additional weapons training, where she learned to use a meteor hammer. In early 100 AG, she met Sneers, a former Earth Kingdom rebel who had traveled to Yu Dao after the dissolution of his group, and the two of them fell in love and began a romantic relationship.

paragraphs.body: In 101 AG, Yu Dao started to see the effects of the ${link_0}. Kori began feeling resentful toward the Fire Lord, thinking that he had betrayed his people. She arrived at the ${link_1} and sneaked into the ${link_2} with the intent of killing Fire Lord Zuko.
paragraphs.text: In 101 AG, Yu Dao started to see the effects of the Harmony Restoration Movement. Kori began feeling resentful toward the Fire Lord, thinking that he had betrayed his people. She arrived at the Fire Nation Capital and sneaked into the Royal Palace with the intent of killing Fire Lord Zuko.

paragraphs.body: While Kori succeeded in incapacitating the guards, Zuko proved to be too much for her and she was captured. Zuko began interrogating her and brought her back to Yu Dao, where he met her father, Mayor Morishita, and her earthbender mother. Initially, Zuko attempted to persuade Kori and her family to return to the Fire Nation; however, Kori, her parents, and a closer look at the life of Yu Dao convinced Zuko that the Fire Nation colonies should stay.
paragraphs.text: While Kori succeeded in incapacitating the guards, Zuko proved to be too much for her and she was captured. Zuko began interrogating her and brought her back to Yu Dao, where he met her father, Mayor Morishita, and her earthbender mother. Initially, Zuko attempted to persuade Kori and her family to return to the Fire Nation; however, Kori, her parents, and a closer look at the life of Yu Dao convinced Zuko that the Fire Nation colonies should stay.

paragraphs.body: Zuko's decision to withdraw his support for the Harmony Restoration Movement, however, made the tensions rise outside the gates of Yu Dao, and Kori organized her cousins, both earthbenders and firebenders, to train for battle.
paragraphs.text: Zuko's decision to withdraw his support for the Harmony Restoration Movement, however, made the tensions rise outside the gates of Yu Dao, and Kori organized her cousins, both earthbenders and firebenders, to train for battle.

paragraphs.body: Some time after the Freedom Fighters' arrival in Yu Dao, Kori and Sneers' romance became strained after Kori learned that Sneers had become one of the leading protesters outside the gates of Yu Dao. When Sneers said that it was time for Kori to choose a side, the Earth Kingdom or the Fire Nation, she stated that she had already chosen, namely to be an earthbending Fire Nation citizen who lived in Yu Dao. As she walked away from Sneers, she left him with an ultimatum: fight for her colony's right to stay in the Earth Kingdom, or side with ${link_0} and break off their relationship.
paragraphs.text: Some time after the Freedom Fighters' arrival in Yu Dao, Kori and Sneers' romance became strained after Kori learned that Sneers had become one of the leading protesters outside the gates of Yu Dao. When Sneers said that it was time for Kori to choose a side, the Earth Kingdom or the Fire Nation, she stated that she had already chosen, namely to be an earthbending Fire Nation citizen who lived in Yu Dao. As she walked away from Sneers, she left him with an ultimatum: fight for her colony's right to stay in the Earth Kingdom, or side with Smellerbee and break off their relationship.

paragraphs.body: Kori continued her relationship with Sneers after he chose to side with the ${link_0}. When Aang and Katara returned to Yu Dao to urge the colonials to evacuate, Kori, together with other members of the Resistance, attacked them with an assortment of weapons, assuming that they had arrived to force them from their homes. Aang proceeded to inform them of the true reason for their arrival, but Kori was undeterred, and boasted that they could handle the Freedom Fighters. However, when Aang revealed that the Earth King and his army were marching toward Yu Dao, she attempted to persuade Aang to help them fight the Earth King, albeit unsuccessfully. As a last resort, Kori introduced the Avatar to the Yu Dao Chapter of the ${link_1}, but her plan backfired, as the fangirls' activities only further solidified Aang's opinion that the Yu Dao colonials needed to be removed.
paragraphs.text: Kori continued her relationship with Sneers after he chose to side with the Yu Dao Resistance. When Aang and Katara returned to Yu Dao to urge the colonials to evacuate, Kori, together with other members of the Resistance, attacked them with an assortment of weapons, assuming that they had arrived to force them from their homes. Aang proceeded to inform them of the true reason for their arrival, but Kori was undeterred, and boasted that they could handle the Freedom Fighters. However, when Aang revealed that the Earth King and his army were marching toward Yu Dao, she attempted to persuade Aang to help them fight the Earth King, albeit unsuccessfully. As a last resort, Kori introduced the Avatar to the Yu Dao Chapter of the Official Avatar Aang Fan Club, but her plan backfired, as the fangirls' activities only further solidified Aang's opinion that the Yu Dao colonials needed to be removed.

paragraphs.body: When the Freedom Fighters breached the wall with a drilling machine, Sneers reluctantly introduced Kori to Smellerbee. Attempts to reason with the Freedom Fighters ended in failure, as a skirmish ensued between the Yu Dao Resistance and the Freedom Fighters. At the same time, the armies of both the Earth Kingdom and Fire Nation arrived and started to battle. ${link_0} ${link_1} entered the town gates and demanded the colonials surrender. Kori refused to cooperate and threw her meteor hammer at him, only for her opponent to shatter it. The battle ended when Aang entered the Avatar State, used earthbending to uplift Yu Dao from the battle, saved Fire Lord Zuko, and managed to reason with the Earth King to spare Yu Dao.
paragraphs.text: When the Freedom Fighters breached the wall with a drilling machine, Sneers reluctantly introduced Kori to Smellerbee. Attempts to reason with the Freedom Fighters ended in failure, as a skirmish ensued between the Yu Dao Resistance and the Freedom Fighters. At the same time, the armies of both the Earth Kingdom and Fire Nation arrived and started to battle. General How entered the town gates and demanded the colonials surrender. Kori refused to cooperate and threw her meteor hammer at him, only for her opponent to shatter it. The battle ended when Aang entered the Avatar State, used earthbending to uplift Yu Dao from the battle, saved Fire Lord Zuko, and managed to reason with the Earth King to spare Yu Dao.

paragraphs.body: After the solution of the escalating crisis and an agreement between Zuko and Earth King Kuei, Kori attended a meeting in the governor's place of Yu Dao, together with Sneers, her family, Avatar Aang, Zuko, and other dignitaries to discuss the future of the city.
paragraphs.text: After the solution of the escalating crisis and an agreement between Zuko and Earth King Kuei, Kori attended a meeting in the governor's place of Yu Dao, together with Sneers, her family, Avatar Aang, Zuko, and other dignitaries to discuss the future of the city.

paragraphs.body: Eventually, it was decided to let the inhabitants of Yu Dao elect a new coalition government in 102 AG. Kori happily announced the results of this election at the city's palace, presenting both the Earth Kingdom and Fire Nation representatives to the assembled crowd.
paragraphs.text: Eventually, it was decided to let the inhabitants of Yu Dao elect a new coalition government in 102 AG. Kori happily announced the results of this election at the city's palace, presenting both the Earth Kingdom and Fire Nation representatives to the assembled crowd.

paragraphs.body: Kori was shown to be headstrong and "rash", according to her father. While usually tame, Kori was fiercely defensive of her homeland of Yu Dao, going as far as to attempt an assassination on the Fire Lord to protect the interests of her home.
paragraphs.text: Kori was shown to be headstrong and "rash", according to her father. While usually tame, Kori was fiercely defensive of her homeland of Yu Dao, going as far as to attempt an assassination on the Fire Lord to protect the interests of her home.

paragraphs.body: Kori trained and practiced her abilities a great degree throughout her childhood, becoming a skilled earthbender. She combined her ${link_0} skills with her earthen meteor hammer, using her ability to control the directions of the attack, thus making her a greater threat.
paragraphs.text: Kori trained and practiced her abilities a great degree throughout her childhood, becoming a skilled earthbender. She combined her bending skills with her earthen meteor hammer, using her ability to control the directions of the attack, thus making her a greater threat.

paragraphs.body: Kori was shown to be close with each of her parents, as they were both worried when she went missing. She also had a romantic relationship with Sneers.
paragraphs.text: Kori was shown to be close with each of her parents, as they were both worried when she went missing. She also had a romantic relationship with Sneers.

paragraphs.body: Kori is the first chronologically mentioned child of a multicultural family in the ${link_0}.
paragraphs.text: Kori is the first chronologically mentioned child of a multicultural family in the World of Avatar.

paragraphs.body: Kori's attire, composed of the colors red and green, reflected her mixed heritage.
paragraphs.text: Kori's attire, composed of the colors red and green, reflected her mixed heritage.

paragraphs.body: Kori had at least five cousins, of whom two were firebenders and three were earthbenders.
paragraphs.text: Kori had at least five cousins, of whom two were firebenders and three were earthbenders.
